Coaching and mentoring are vital skills for teams within organisations as well as for work with particular individuals in education and childrenÂs services
column3: social and health services. The foundation degree in coaching and mentoring will raise studentsÂ awareness of the need for coaching and mentoring within a range

column2: as well as developing the professional knowledge and skills necessary to engage in effective supportive and empowering relationships.

column1: Taught sessions will include a balance of lecture and practical workshops, creating links between theory and practice. The programme will consist of six (20 credit) modules per year. At level 1 core modules will include the role of the coach/mentor
column3: basic counselling skills and Âgoing for goalÂ for personal and professional target setting. Level 2 will extend expertise and skills with modules on the psychology of behaviour
column5: legislation and formal practices and research.

column1: Graduates with FdA Coaching and Mentoring

could look to work with individuals in learning, social, health or community situations or within organisations developing and supporting staff across a range of environments. There is also the opportunity to progress to honours degrees in Childhood and Youth, Psychology or Primary Education.
